documents.document: @urbancyclist @cuthbertneil I guess it's what Labour did to the SNP over minimum pricing and the SNP did to Labour over presumed consent.
@cuthbertneil Except we'll oppose it. Small but important difference.
@cuthbertneil Yes. And continue to disagree where we disagree. Other parties should try it. It's refreshing. 😜
@LFBarfe I guess some are worried about what happened to Jo Cox?
Time for some game theory. https://t.co/Br7DPFb4H0
@cglendinning95 aha has @StephenGethins seen this?
@spacecommunism "some more milk on your acab?"
@CharlotteGore @Niaccurshi and in Scotland I use "would you support independence if you knew Westminster would be Tory forever"
@anthonyjwells the White Paper and EEA ones in there are interesting. And "this power shall not come into effect until" - good structure.
@anthonyjwells @JolyonMaugham Ooh: got a link to what has been lodged? I have low expectations given the state of the opposition.
I don't agree the #MuslimBan is a headfake, or that protests suit Trump, but it is a test of how far they can go. https://t.co/SVSjPoB3R3
@anthonyjwells @JolyonMaugham Aye: am aware of the efforts on it. But Parliament passing with those amends would likely secure court time?
@aimsbtw And when STV finally told him Trump would no longer try to negotiate with him, he said "THANK CHRIST FOR THAT."
@aimsbtw Trump wanted his land at any price (and tried to make Michael's 90-yr-old mother homeless by compulsory purchase).
@aidanskinner It's never been tested, obviously, but there's been voices in both sides. Would require another quick court case maybe.
@alexhern that's one problem: add to that the fact that both halves of Labour have gone off the rails, plus no-one trusts the Lib Dems.
@aimsbtw And when Trump said he'd build the wall Michael flew the biggest Mexican flag he could find right by Trump's course.
@aimsbtw ah! Michael fought Trump ten years ago over the golf course next to his farm in Aberdeenshire. A most eloquent critic.
Something like that. But hardly difficult. And let HMG argue A50 notification cannot be withdrawn *and* Parliament is sovereign.
Amend 2/2. Add: 1(4). If those terms are not approved by a resolution of each House the notification under A50 shall be withdrawn.
Amend 1/2. Add: 1(3) Prior to the United Kingdom's withdrawal from the EU the terms of that withdrawal shall be laid before Parliament.
The short Bill looks fairly readily amendable. https://t.co/rxeTub9FfJ
And I was pleased to see the SWP's attempt to turn it into a front for them got proper pushback. https://t.co/FWh7k6JMrr
Just met this very confident and focused 🦊 https://t.co/ERJr5omS23

@blacktaako personally one of the reasons I want independence for Scotland is that it'd be a bit easier to change policy here
@blacktaako for non-EU nationals it's all up to the member states, so I guess in or out we could fix this if enough pressure was put on
@blacktaako I'm anti-all-borders altogether; personally I don't have a clue how we get there but Brexit certainly isn't helping
@blacktaako yup: and yet I still believe things would be even worse outside - the Brexit vote isn't delivering some Lexit dream
@blacktaako oh dear - have you blocked me or should I pay up? I do think leaving the EU will make things even worse for non-EU migrants tho.
@rheawolfson sorry - since I asked you I'm told Mound and SP is the legit one, the other is SWP (so hope to see you and SR there?)

@rheawolfson Rhea, are there two different events on? I've seen 5pm at Waverley Gate touted too.
@RozKaveney Do you think Bannon thinks of himself as Christian? I'm sceptical. I think it's just a rhetorical tool for his white supremacy.
@kindofwater and from a comms perspective, I'd say the core might just be to repeatedly tie other non-US anti-migrant chat to Trump.

@euanmccolm what?!
@euanmccolm Trudeau's a liberal and is making a liberal argument against Trump's racist Muslim ban. Not sure what's complicated there.

@LondonerAlex agree... proper opposition needs to be something more robust than weak-ass social democracy
@hikari_no_yume Some of that might indeed help at the edges
@graemedownie Aye maybe - I guess what I mean is "how long will it last and what follows it"
This might be the start of the world's darkest phase since 1945. Or it might be a last violent spasm of white supremacy.
You might wish to mourn some mythological set of American values. But Trump is real and there is no middle way with him either.
You can wish there weren't actual would-be genocidal Nazis giving TV interviews in the street. But that ship has sailed.
As with punching Nazis in the street, Trump has forced the issue. Governments and activists can either oppose or help. No middle way.
Many more still held for precisely zero good reason. https://t.co/IhzKNN0jqP

@NinersNation I've just blocked that guy: would appreciate untagging me if you want to keep trying to get him to understand. 💪
@joey_mcl Feels like it might be telling in some way. But what could it signify?
@Bow_to_Muhammad @danstuffe ahaha sharing a blog with "fuhrer" in the title: if you're Muslim I'm Buddha. Away back to 4chan with you.
When his lawyers asked who they should speak to, just to get access to him, this is what they were told. https://t.co/PXLTgFN05Q
@rogersm @JohnNephew He's got refugee status in Sweden based on a legitimate fear of persecution in Iraq.
Absolutely all "we must control migration" rhetoric facilitates and normalises this kind of policy.
The speed with which Trump has started to impose fascist regulations is surprising given the normally glacial nature of change in the US.
Whole brutal story here. https://t.co/UudOVBcJe4
He got stopped, denied legal access, and they're sending him back to Iraq, not Sweden.
So he was in Sweden, got permission for family reunion, and Trump's announcement came out when he was on the plane.
He'd worked for the US in Iraq for ten years (which is presumably why it's not safe for him there).
One of the Iraqis who was stopped at JFK had been living in Sweden, got permission to reunite with his family in America.
And this is the utterly obscene answer given by May's office. https://t.co/bVrtdg0ogQ
This is the question asked. https://t.co/icIPh6niES
@HealthUntoDeath I agree. It's a terrifying teachable moment.
@HealthUntoDeath I know too many politicians perhaps. I agree that if you think about borders all the way down they're intrinsically racist.
@HealthUntoDeath So I'm okay with someone who supports the better former position for now, and will seek to persuade them it's flawed too.
@HealthUntoDeath Even there it's not the debate they've heard. That's all "the EU's liberal on borders (!)" vs Faragism.
@HealthUntoDeath I fear my first tweet to you on this was unclear. I support open borders for many reasons inc that. And coffee for me.
@HealthUntoDeath Yanow, I'd say the "minimally decent" bit about being pro-choice. Everyone with a view on that knows the options.
@HealthUntoDeath I semi-agree. It's my position for that amongst other issues. But it's not an argument 99%+ of the pop.n have even heard.
